page.title: 01North Side of NiddValley
page.content: This is a rural area with very little settlement. the south ofthe area ajoins a larer reservoir which supplies Leeds with its water supply. Around this part the land is divided into small fields each bordered by a dry stone wall a feature of the area - and grazed by sheep and few beef cattle. Looking up the hillside the grass changes from green to a yellowy tussocky covering, and the fields increase in size. The walls become uncared for and develop many gaps. There are small woods-mainly coniferous trees standing in organised rows. Higher up is dark open moorside - the heather taking the plce of the grass. In this area rocks can be seen. Here pheasants are reared and enjoy their short lives beore shooting parties make sport.
